reviewText: I love this Dvd collection I got it for the Cher Christmas songs, theres O Holly Night, Jingle Bells with Sonny, And a Gift of Song. This is a must have for any die hard Cher Fan. This set contains three episodes of the Sonny and Cher Christmas shows. This Dvd is the closest thing you can get to a Cher Christmas album, Cher also has another song Christmas Baby come Home on A Rosie Christmas cd. So there you have it All the christmas songs Cher has ever done.
summary: Contains 3 out of the 4 christmas songs Cher has done.
Title: The Sonny & Cher Christmas Collection

reviewText: 3 great classic variety show with Sonny and Cher and Chastity (who's now Chaz!)... the comedy sketches may be lame, but it's worth the few bucks just to see those fabu Bob Mackie 70's costumes he did for Cher and cast... and of course, there is Cher's singing!
Title: The Sonny & Cher Christmas Collection

reviewText: I had forgotten how much I enjoyed their variety show.  I will be enjoying this for many Christmas' to come...
Title: The Sonny & Cher Christmas Collection

reviewText: Yeah.. not funny.. not fun.. not what I want to see. I guess as you get older things you loved as a child are not always as good. Only people that will enjoy this are true Cher fan who don't care what she does, as long as she's there.
Title: The Sonny & Cher Christmas Collection

reviewText: It was interesting to take a stroll on memory lane.  They had some great supporting cast and guests.  And it was weird to see the now Mr Chas Bono as littlw Miss Chasity Bono. She was included on the Holiday shows.
Title: The Sonny & Cher Christmas Collection

reviewText: This DVD will take you back to hopefully a better simpler time.  I actually got to see Sonny and Cher when I was a kid back in the 60's at the Circle Star theater out in California.  If you like Christmas past and Sonny and Cher you may want to check this DVD out.
Title: The Sonny & Cher Christmas Collection

reviewText: OK, there is some good music here. However, the attempt to drag their daughter Chastity into these specials kind of distracts from the program. There are a few fun bits on the program but I don't believe some of the "spontanious banter" is as spontanious as advertised. Still, it is a fun show from the days before militant athiests used the ACLU as a club.
summary: Not the best thing I ever watched
Title: The Sonny & Cher Christmas Collection

reviewText: This is a single DVD release of "The Sonny and Cher Comedy Hour", that contain three Christmas themed episodes.  They originally aired on CBS in 1972, 1973 and 1976 respectively.  The first show in 1972 has special guest William Conrad who also starred on his CBS show "Cannon" at that time, who appears in a few of the sketches, including one where he plays a street corner Santa.  Another segment in this episode is a memorable animated music video part of the series where Sonny and Cher sing Three Dog Night's "Black and White" that was a hit that same year.In 1973, William Conrad guest stars again on another Christmas show.  This time, playing different characters like a vagabond visiting homes on Christmas Eve.  Plus a sketch where Sonny Bono shows Conrad a fictitious Christmas album, "Sonny Bono Sings Christmas Songs".  There's a lot more to see on this show too!The most surprising episode of all, from 1976, was their 'post divorce' holiday show, appearing with their daughter Chasity and a surprise guest, Bob Keeshan as Captain Kangaroo from his daily series also airing on CBS that time.  Hey! Watch where Bob Keeshan in a "Sonny's Pizza" sketch where he plays an unusual kind of angel flying over people dining alone on Christmas Eve.  You'll really flip yourself over this!You won't find a great true 1970's holiday treasure DVD like this one.  Sonny and Cher's Christmas shows is a 'must have' for DVD collectors today!
Title: The Sonny & Cher Christmas Collection

reviewText: Funny comedy everyone can watch and enjoy. Christmas guests include William Conrad and Bernadette Peters. Chastity is very cute as the Bono family entertains us. Cher as her character Laverne is hilarious.
Title: The Sonny & Cher Christmas Collection

reviewText: If you are a Sonny and Cher fan this is a terrific, campy collection, and it feels great to go back to a simpler, sillier time.  The pair does their take many Christmas classics, and Cher looks terrific in her typical wild constumes.
Title: The Sonny & Cher Christmas Collection

reviewText: She's my most all time favorite singer, what a classic show... If you remember their shows, you need this for your collection!
Title: The Sonny & Cher Christmas Collection

reviewText: Fun and full of laughs! I bought this for my father who as everything...he loves it!
Title: The Sonny & Cher Christmas Collection

reviewText: I remembered these two being much less corny than they appear now, but the music was great.  I didn't care for the "Sonny's Pizza" skit in each of the three episodes, as they seemed to go on forever and weren't very funny.  They also must have recorded the episodes live because the stumbling over words and long pauses are all in tact.  But the elderly people I care for (in their 90's) seemed to like the episodes just fine and thanked me for playing them.  At least it was in color and the costumes were very entertaining.
Title: The Sonny & Cher Christmas Collection

reviewText: With Sonny & Cher, you're going to get a groovy Christmas with so much bad comedy that only the Grinch would appreciate it for the misery it causes.  Nevertheless, the beat still goes on, and some of it is enjoyable.The DVD has good sound & picture quality with a video jukebox of just the Christmas songs.  There are 3 episodes, two from "The Sonny & Cher Comedy Hour" in 1972 and 1973; and one with really weird vibes from the divorce years of "The Sonny & Cher Show" in 1976.  All three episodes start with Sonny & Cher singing "Jingle Bells."  The song in the first & third episodes is an oddly flat version which is semi-enjoyable and very perplexing.-In the first episode:  William Conrad (Cannon), Chastity Bono guest star.  There are several non-Christmas songs, some that are just absurdly funny, like the cast number of "Sonny & Cher on Vacation."  The most surreal moment is when William Conrad reads a Bible/Christmas story as Sonny, Cher & Chastity listen and look oddly morose...though I think it was their attempt at looking serious.  At the end, when Cher says, "Good night.  Merry Christmas," she sounds like she is forcing herself.  Of course, bubbly was never really her calling card.-In the second episode ( the most Christmassy of the bunch):  Guests are - William Conrad, an adorable Teri Garr (show regular) and Chastity.  This time out, "Jingle Bells" is done by the whole cast with a more festive look and feel.  Other songs:  "The Gift of Love"/"O Come All Ye Faithful"/"Noel"/"Deck the Halls"/"O Holy Night"/"Joy to the World" sung by Cher, William Conrad & cast in a Victorian/snowy setting, Sonny nasal talk/sings "The Twelfth of Never" with Cher & Chastity unconvincingly playing in the fake snow in the background.-In the third episode (the strangest of the bunch):  You'll find Sonny & Cher divorced and the smell of Christmas cookies doesn't fill the air, but tension certainly does.  Guest stars include:  Captain Kangaroo, Bernadette Peters, mimes Shields & Yarnell, Chastity & Cher introduces her new baby from her new marriage.  There's a depressing skit about four lonely people in a restaurant; it seems to reflect the mindset of divorced Sonny & Cher at the time.  Songs include:  "White Christmas," Santa Claus is Coming to Town," "I Saw Mommy Kissing Santa Claus" and "Walking in a Winter Wonderland."  When they sing "I've Got You Babe," at the end, the song is just dripping in discomfort.The Sonny's Pizzeria skits are interminable; they are both very stiff as comedians, making Cher's Oscar a Christmas miracle.  Guess she took some lessons...  These skits show up in all three episodes.  Oh, the humanity!When you think Christmas cheer, you probably don't think Sonny & Cher; and with good reason.  Cher's schtick is sarcasm and comedic insults directed at Sonny, and Sonny is just as monotone as ever.  If you're looking for warm holiday fuzzies, look away.  But if you love Sonny, Cher, their music, the hair & costumes or just have fond memories of their variety show, you'll probably enjoy this groovy Christmas.
summary: Groovy Christmas & Hip Holidays with Tension On the Side
Title: The Sonny & Cher Christmas Collection

reviewText: Back when Sonny & Cher were on the tube, it was a great show. They made a great team, I really enjoied watching them. It was to bad that they had to break up.
Title: The Sonny & Cher Christmas Collection

reviewText: Loved Sonny & Cher and always watched their TV shows AND owned all of their albumns.  This is definitely a "blast from the past"!  I highly recommend it for all age groups.
Title: The Sonny & Cher Christmas Collection

reviewText: Being unfamiliar with this duo (I came into the world just about the time that this show was ending), this is the first real exposure that I ever have received to Sonny and Cher as a comedy duo.I wasn't sure what to expect, but I find the show to have been very well-written and performed, and as most fans probably knew already, Sonny was the talented one. He drove the entire series.It's rather fascinating to me to peek into the popular culture of previous eras like this. Hard to believe that a show like this one could succeed today, with its lengthy skits and musical numbers. Our microwave society would get bored.As a DVD presentation, this also is a good one, which includes one cool extra: a music-video showcase of all of the songs over the three Christmas episodes collected here.Good pickup for someone who, like me, loves Christmas specials; great pickup for fans of the team.
Title: The Sonny & Cher Christmas Collection

reviewText: Good DVD, but wish their was more dancing! Not much dancing in the episodes. It was interesting to see Cher more confident between each Christmas episode.  It was also great to see Shields & Yarnell has puppets!  And Captain Kangaroo and Bernadette Peters!!!  The last episode is a little sad as Cher and Sonny are no longer together and you can tell by they sadness that comes across Sonny's eyes off and on.
summary: Good, but wish their was more dancing!
Title: The Sonny & Cher Christmas Collection
